Content.Name: Add an Assignment
Content.Title: Add an Assignment
Content.BodyCopy:
Objective
To demonstrate how to add an assignment in an I-Learn course.

Instructions
  1. Navigate to the "Course Plan" of the desired course.
  2. Locate the Module the Assignment is to be located in and click the corresponding "Add."
  3. Select "Assignment."
  4. Fill in Title and Description.
  5. Attach any necessary documents by clicking "Add attachment."
  6. Locate the desired file from the resources and click "OK."
    (Note: this tutorial will not go over how to upload files into the resources.)
  7. Set due dates by checking the "Due date and time" box and selecting a day from the calendar as well as a time. You can add a grace period by checking "Allow late submissions" and setting the options to use a grace period.
  8. To have the assignment added to the Gradebook be sure the box is checked corresponding with "Add to Gradebook."
    NOTE: If using weighted grades, the "Relative Weight in category" is for how much this item will be weighted against other items in the same category.
    NOTE: the "Score entry" is for selecting what type of score will be entered on this item (points, rubric, percent, or letter grade).
    NOTE: You can select the "Treat unscored as zero" option to automatically grade the assignment a zero if nothing is submitted by the due date.
  9. To have the student submit information and documents online be sure to select "Single document" or if multiple documents need to be submitted select "Multiple documents" from the drop down menu.
  10. When finished, click "Done."
